commitResults.messageTitle: Update highlightjs method call syntax for inline code (#1691)
Fix footer margin on medium viewports (#1692)
Update projectStructure.md (#1695)
Enhance appearance of minimised panels (#1694)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Add caret icon (as most minimised panels tend to use a caret icon to
show that it is a clickable button

* Add top margin (as expanded cards also have a top margin but not a
bottom margin, top margin was chosen. This is to prevent ugly cluttering)

commitResults.messageTitle: Optimise search input size (#1760)
Improve deployment documentation (site.json + deployment files) (#1789)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Minor documentation improvements for consistency
* Also changes panels from minimal to seamless for user convenience
* Adds page navigation to siteJsonFile due to the length of the page,
this also serves as a helpful summary.

commitResults.messageTitle: Docs: Remove index.md files from being searched (#1805)
Changes 'Markbind' to 'MarkBind' in documentation and comments (#1828)
Improve devguide to follow style guide (#1829)
commitResults.messageBody:
Also correct typos, broken links, and add documentation for
markbind init template flag

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve default title for search by removing file format ending (#1826)
Include screenshot of dark themed code (#1827)
commitResults.messageBody: Docs: Include screenshot of dark themed code and clean up page

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix missing images from plugin page (#1711)
Add relative links to template file (#1728)
Hotfix for appveyor npm upgrade (#1747)
Resolve bug regarding backslashes in convert feature (#1742)
Fix convert command generating extra newline (#1746)
Remove `.mbdf` and `.mbd` as markbind supported file extensions (#1762)
commitResults.messageBody:
Syntax parsers do not work with `.mbdf` and `.mbd` and
this functionality could be implemented using other means (e.g. pagesExclude)

Refer to this for the full discussion #1672.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve SettingUp documentation (#1795)
Add Annotation Feature (#1858)
commitResults.messageBody:
Add Annotation Feature

Users want to annotate images but have no way of doing so.

Implementing a <annotate> and <a-point> components to help
users annotate over images.

This allows users to specify the image in <annotate> and specify
the points in <a-point>.

Refer to issue #898 for the initial suggestion.

commitResults.messageTitle: Pin colorsjs at version 1.4.0 (#1705)
Update markdown-it version and relevant patches (#1701)
commitResults.messageBody:
A minor bug in markdown-it-attrs prevents the addition
of multiple classes for the hr elements. Its latest version
fixes the issue.

Let's update the version of the plugin and the core
markdown-it package to fix the above-mentioned bug.

commitResults.messageTitle: Give easy ways to add different types of horizontal lines (#1685)
commitResults.messageBody:
No convenient syntax is available to style the hr element.

Let's add some helper classes for the hr element to
improve its style.

Users may use a combination of the available classes and
BootStrap border-color classes to customize the look of
the hr element.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix PageNav raw variable interpolation syntax display (#1724)
commitResults.messageBody:
The raw variable interpolation syntax can be displayed
by wrapping it with {% raw %} {% endraw %}. Even though
the {{ content }} is showing up correctly in the main page,
the generated PageNav text retains {{}} and causes vue
to incorrectly hide it due to rendering error.

Let's add a v-pre attribute whenever there is {{}} in
the navigation text.

This will allow content wrapped {{}} to display in PageNav.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add documentation on indentation support for components (#1719)
commitResults.messageBody:
Users may need to indent components to align with nearby
content.

Let's add in a section in 'tips and tricks' to show examples
of how to indent components with bootstrap utility classes.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add v-pre to all anchor elements in pageNav (#1732)
commitResults.messageBody:
v-pre is added to anchor elements of pageNav on a need basis
to escape raw {} syntax.

Let's instead add v-pre to all pageNav anchor elements to
keep it simple and performant.

commitResults.messageTitle: Adjust line numbers setting for code blocks (#1734)
commitResults.messageBody:
Line numbers are provided by default and there is no way
to override it globally.

Let's include a codeLineNumbers option in site.json to
enable a global configuration of line numbers. Line numbers
are also now hidden by default.

This is more convenient for authors as line numbers tend to
be hidden manually in practice. This is also consistent with other
markdown renderers.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix docs formatting and typo (#1750)
Update CI to test on all major OS and remove Appveyor (#1757)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, we are using GitHub actions and Appveyor to
run tests for PRs.

Let's remove the use of Appveyor and consolidate CI tests
in GitHub actions. Let's also update the setup-node action
version.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move docs deployment from Travis CI to GitHub Actions (#1759)
commitResults.messageBody:
There is a change to Travis' pricing model.

Let's move docs deployment into GitHub Actions and remove
the usage of Travis from our CI processes.

This will potentially remove any costs incurred when using Travis.

commitResults.messageTitle: Disabling deploy-docs on forks to fix CI errors (#1765)
Disable fuzzy link and mention autolink feature in UG (#1779)
Add badges to README.md (#1785)
commitResults.messageBody: Add badges to README.md

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix tipBox content overflow (#1787)
commitResults.messageBody: Fix tipBox content overflow with min-width

commitResults.messageTitle: Update workflow and project structure of devGuide (#1786)
Cancel workflow runs when multiple commits are synchronized to a PR (#1821)
Support `$$` as a delimiter for math formulae (#1824)
commitResults.messageBody:
Current delimiters for math formulae do not allow authors
who are using dollars(`$$`) for their equations to adopt
MarkBind easily.

Let's add an optional plugin that can add `$$` as additional
delimiters for authors who have content with this syntax.

Since not all authors use MarkBind with math formulae, an
optional plugin can prevent any accidental performance
issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add component for folder structure visualisations (#1807)
commitResults.messageBody:
It is tedious to manually create tree-like structure diagrams.

Let's add a component to conveniently convert
an indented list of items into tree-like textual output.

This is especially useful for file system visualisations.

commitResults.messageTitle: Ensure the referenced versions of MarkBind packages are exact (#1848)
commitResults.messageBody:
The use of range versions for internal packages results in
incorrect versioning of MarkBind packages when using an
older version of MarkBind.

Let's remove the compatible versioning and use the exact match.

This ensures the versions of internal packages downloaded
will be exact and provide the expected functionalities.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix unexpected behavior in UG due to invalid HTML markup (#1837)
commitResults.messageBody:
Invalid HTML markup may cause Vue hydration issues.

Let's replace span tags with div tags to avoid invalid
inclusion of block-level elements in span tags.

This prevents possible errors in HTML syntax.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve existing GitHub issue templates (#1860)
commitResults.messageBody:
* Update issue template

* Fix issues

* Fix typo

* Update title

* Update fields

* Update template

* remove placeholder

* Remove title

* Adjust template

commitResults.messageTitle: Update documentation on MarkBind GitHub Actions (#1880)
commitResults.messageBody:
The existing GitHub Action "markbind-action" has been
revamped to improve its functionalities.

Let's add a reference to "markbind-action" in our
user guide to highlight this helper workflow. Let's also
include a section in our developer guide to explain how
to develop and maintain the "markbind-action" repo.

This helps users discover "markbind-action" and use it in
their CI/CD workflow. The dev docs will help developers
continue to improve "markbind-action"

commitResults.messageTitle: Update CI to run on all PR events (#1878)
Fix edge cases of link validation and conversion (#1875)
commitResults.messageBody:
Invalid intralinks have been reported in MarkBind docs. The
reasons are 1. actual invalid link 2. file path contains a space
3. Email link wrongly validated.

Let's fix all three link validation & conversion errors.
File paths with %20 will be correctly checked for
existence. Email(tel) links will no longer be appended
with the base URL or validated as intralink.

The removal of invalid link behavior will allow
the link & link validation mechanism to function
properly.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add an explanation on how to use JavaScript chart libraries (#1872)
commitResults.messageBody:
Charts can be useful in MarkBind sites to display data.

Let's include a section in our UG to highlight the existing
(basic) support for JavaScript chart libraries in MarkBind.

This is the most flexible option that MarkBind users can
go for to utilize a JavaScript chart library of their choice.

commitResults.messageTitle: Fix UG display issues when using the outputBox boilerplate (#1889)
Update GitHub issue template checkbox to dropdown (#1897)
Update CI steps to set up Graphviz and Java for PlantUML support (#1905)
commitResults.messageBody:
PlantUML feature requires both Java and Graphviz to be installed.
Current CI steps do not guarantee the presence of these
dependencies. This means some PlantUML diagrams were
unable to be generated correctly.

Let's update our CI steps to ensure both Java and Graphviz are
available in the build image to support PlantUML syntax.

This will ensure usage of PlantUML syntax can be supported in
our tests and our documentation.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove package-lock file in packages/core (#1908)
Add utility GitHub reusable workflows for PR preview (#1853)
Fix undefined source path reported in the console warning (#1917)
Add Graphviz check when PlantUML diagrams are used (#1912)
commitResults.messageBody:
Without Graphviz, PlantUML diagrams generated may
contain errors. Users may not be aware that diagrams are
generated incorrectly if they do not serve up the pages.

Let's add a check and warn users in the console if the
installation of Graphviz is missing.

This helps to keep users informed in the console when
the needed installation is missing. Users are also informed
of a way to disable the warning in `site.json`.

commitResults.messageTitle: Improve User Guide - Adding Pages (#1923)
commitResults.messageBody: Improve User Guide - Adding Pages

commitResults.messageTitle: Add margin above code block headers (#1706)
Deprecate attributes for Dropdown, Box, Popover, Modal (#1722)
Fix typo in docs for Tooltips (#1758)
commitResults.messageBody: Fix typo in docs for tooltips

commitResults.messageTitle: Allow reactivity in popovers and tooltips (#1748)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, popovers and tooltips are implemented using bootstrap-vue 
directives. 

Such an implementation is not reactive which limits the content that 
can be used in a popover/tooltip. Reactivity is important for future 
enhancements like supporting the src attribute (#59). Furthermore, it 
is incompatible with SSR, resulting in hydration problems that have 
arisen in #1615.

Using Vue components for tooltips and popovers, and Portals for 
triggers, allows us to avoid the issues with reactivity and SSR. 

Let's use components instead of bootstrap-vue directives to implement 
popovers and tooltips. This gives better support of reactivity while 
avoiding SSR issues.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update outdated information in docs  (#1777)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the effect attribute is not implemented in popovers and 
tooltips, which means that using this attribute has no effect. 
However, the effect attribute is currently included in the examples 
for popovers. This may be confusing for readers. 

Let's remove all occurrences of the effect attribute from the docs 
in places where it has no effect. This will prevent readers from 
mistaking it as a valid attribute. 

Other minor grammatical errors were fixed as well.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove unused effect attribute from tests (#1783)
commitResults.messageBody:
Currently, the effect attribute is not implemented for both popovers 
and tooltips. However, it is included in some of the tests for these 
components. This may be confusing and clutter the codebase. 

Let's remove the effect attribute from these tests, to avoid confusion 
on whether or not this is a valid attribute.

commitResults.messageTitle: Implement src attribute for popovers (#1780)
commitResults.messageBody:
Content can be supplied to popovers through either the content slot, or
content attribute.

Manually providing popover contents may be inconvenient if an author
wants to reference content from elsewhere on the site. 

Let's implement the src attribute for popovers, so that authors can
reference content from source files. This is more convenient for
authors, while helping to ensure consistency in website contents.

Using the src attribute maintains consistency with other components such
as Panels and Includes, which also use src.

The src attribute was implemented with a static approach to avoid
potential positioning issues. In the case that multiple contents are
supplied, the following priority is used: content slot > content
attribute > src attribute.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update docs for pop-ups (#1832)
Improve accessibility of pop-ups (#1833)
commitResults.messageBody:
According to the bootstrap-vue docs, the default value of `hover` for
popups is impossible to trigger for keyboard users, resulting in
accessibility issues.

Let's use `hover focus` as the default value, as this provides an
additional and unobtrusive way of displaying pop-up contents.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update markdown-it-linkify-images to v2.0.0 (#1838)
commitResults.messageBody:
markdown-it-linkify-images at v1.1.1 overrides image width and height
attributes.

Let's upgrade to v2.0.0 which fixes this problem.

commitResults.messageTitle: Use vue-final-modal for modal components (#1849)
commitResults.messageBody:
Modals are implemented using bootstrap-vue directives.

bootstrap-vue has dependencies on specific versions of Bootstrap and
Vue, making it hard for MarkBind to migrate to Bootstrap 5, or Vue 3.

vue-final-modal has minimal dependencies, and supports both Vue 2 and 3.

Let's use vue-final-modal for modals instead. Doing so allows for future
migrations to Bootstrap 5 or Vue 3, without having to wait for
bootstrap-vue to migrate first. 

Vue is also upgraded from v2.6.11 to v2.6.14, to meet the dependencies
of vue-final-modal v2.4.1.

commitResults.messageTitle: Report broken links only once (#1819)
commitResults.messageBody:
When a link is validated and found to be broken, a warning is logged for
each time such a link is found. 

This makes the logs messy and harder to read while not providing
actionable information on which links to fix. Furthermore, logging each
link while the site is building will disrupt the CLI progress bar.

Let's use a site-wide abstraction to validate all the links at once and
report only unique broken links. Doing so allows us to avoid duplicate
link reporting and create a cleaner logging output.

commitResults.messageTitle: Migrate popovers and tooltips to floating-vue (#1868)
commitResults.messageBody:
Popovers and tooltips are implemented using bootstrap-vue. 

bootstrap-vue has dependencies on both Vue and Bootstrap, and has not
migrated the latest versions. This is a blocker for MarkBind's
migration of these dependencies.

Let's use floating-vue's Menu and Tooltip components for Popovers and
Tooltips respectively. floating-vue supports both Vue 2 and Vue 3, and
has fewer dependencies. This allows us to migrate to Vue 3 and 
Bootstrap 5 more easily in the future.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add Components page to developer guide (#1865)
commitResults.messageBody: Add Writing Components page to dev docs

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove bootstrap-vue (#1873)
commitResults.messageBody:
bootstrap-vue is no longer used in MarkBind as it relies on Vue 2 and
Bootstrap 4, both which we plan to upgrade. Its components have been
migrated to other libraries.

Let's remove all mentions and instances of bootstrap-vue from MarkBind
to fully remove this dependency.

commitResults.messageTitle: Migrate utilities to Bootstrap V5 (#1834)
Migrate breaking changes for badges (#1884)
Migrate close buttons (#1886)
Remove jumbotron class (#1885)
Migrate dropdown components (#1888)
Namespace Bootstrap data attributes with data-bs- (#1892)
Migrate MarkBind's quizzes and questions (#1890)
Fix spacing for navbars and searchbars (#1900)
Migrate horizontal rules (#1901)
commitResults.messageBody:
In Bootstrap 5, `<hr>` elements now use height instead of border to
better support the size attribute. However, since MarkBind's hr styles
support dotted/dashed/double lines, `<hr>` needs a border-based
implementation. 

Let's minimally override Bootstrap 5's `<hr>` styling to continue
supporting styled horizontal rules.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor includePanelProcessor and MdAttributeRenderer (#1896)
Migrate Bootswatch themes to v5.1.3 (#1898)
Prevent Navbars from being printed (#1906)
Fix typos in docs (#1902)
Fix modal positioning in panel headers (#1910)
commitResults.messageBody: Fix modal positioning in panel headers
